issue.title: automatically activate USE_RASPBERRY_PI define
issue.body:
Proposal to fix #1310.

Leaving at Draft until someone with access to a Raspberry Pi could confirm correctness of this and/or amends suitably. @dstebila ? @Martyrshot ?

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: @dstebila @Martyrshot PR update as discussed yesterday. Please check things now still work OK on RPi.

issue.title: OQS Enabled Envoy Contribution
issue.body:
I hope I have checked all the boxes in the contribution guide.

Thank you!

Daniel

comment.body:
@baentsch apologies for dragging on this

- make_define added
- certs removed and instructions for gen_cert.sh added to README in tls folder
- typo fixed
- USAGE.md fixed

> Finally, is the understanding correct that you don't want the resultant image(s) to be hosted in the "openquantumsafe" namespace at docker hub?

Please do add to the openquantumsafe docker! I have updated all lines to reference openquantumsafe/envoy or openquantumsafe/envoy:latest. I assume this doesn't exist yet, so it will throw an error until it does. For example, [here](https://github.com/drouhana/oqs-demos/blob/65cfd957b99b97524c7cc553f07b798d0cbcebac/envoy/tls/Dockerfile#L4)

I have also added to the .circlci. Please let me know if it is terrible and needs correcting, I tried to follow what the other entries had done for testing.

issue.title: Classify algorithm status
issue.body:
A concrete NIST announcement date, hurray: https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/g/pqc-forum/c/7yLIZcFOMF0/m/vn43l1tQAQAJ

Bets still accepted.... :-) Eliminating McEliece and SPHINCS+ would be a boon for our CI runtime (and the world's power-consumption-induced CO2 emissions).

comment.body:
I've prepared the following summary of the status of our implementations. I thought it was best placed here, but I can break it out into another issue if need be.

# KEMS

| Algorithm Name   | Update?        | Comments                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|:-----------------|:---------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BIKE             | Yes            | [Implementaton](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/main/src/kem/bike/additional_r3/README.md) corresponds to `BIKE_Spec.2020.05.03.1.pdf` spec, whereas the [latest specification](https://bikesuite.org/#spec) is `BIKE_Spec.2022.10.10.1.pdf`.                           |
| Classic McEliece | Yes            | Already noted [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/1314).                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| FrodoKEM         | No             | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| HQC              | Yes            | Implementation taken from PQClean, whose [is based on the 2020-10-01 specification](https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/blob/master/crypto_kem/hqc-rmrs-128/META.yml#L25). Latest version is [2021/06/06](https://pqc-hqc.org/implementation.html).                                       |
| Kyber            | Might as well? | Implementation based on commit [8e00ec73035147d18b27d06048dff322f8de1f29](https://github.com/pq-crystals/kyber/commit/8e00ec73035147d18b27d06048dff322f8de1f29), there is one commit (and merge commit) after, that fixes a comment typo.                                                |
| Kyber (ARM)      | Yes            | Taken from PQClean, which is based on `neon-ntt` commit [c6ffbcd1e5590e4dddbc604fc80d2ad756485b4d](https://github.com/neon-ntt/neon-ntt/tree/c6ffbcd1e5590e4dddbc604fc80d2ad756485b4d); a more recent commit `328d80a81ea9ff1f0bb72123460fd941795f6157` seems to have relevant changes. |
| NTRU             | No             | Taken from PQClean, where its been removed. The latest update to NTRU was on [2020-10-16](https://ntru.org/index.shtml).                                                                                                                                                                 |
| NTRU-Prime       | No. Remove     | No longer in the NIST PQC competition.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Saber            | No. Remove     | No longer in the NIST PQC competition.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

# Signatures

| Algorithm Name           | Update?     | Comments                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|:-------------------------|:------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| CRYSTALS-Dilithium       | Maybe?      | Implementation based on commit [61b51a71701b8ae9f546a1e5d220e1950ed20d06](https://github.com/pq-crystals/dilithium/commit/61b51a71701b8ae9f546a1e5d220e1950ed20d06). There is one commit after which adds an additonal license. |
| CRYSTALS-Dilithium (ARM) | Yes         | Same situation as Kyber (ARM).                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Falcon                   | Yes         | Already noted [here](https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/issues/464).                                                                                                                                                            |
| Picnic                   | No. Remove. | No longer in the NIST PQC competition.                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Rainbow                  | No. Remove. | No longer in the NIST PQC competition.                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| SPHINCS+                 | Yes         | Already noted [here](https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/issues/446).                                                                                                                                                            |
